original: Kolmodin, Carl Israel, vicekonsul, grosshandlare, Visby, f. 21/6/76 i Ro-ma, Gotl. 1., av Johan K. o. Rosalie Höggren. G. 07 m. Elva Forsberg. Barn: Carl-Olof f. 08, Bo 10, Ingrid 12. — Egen firma i Visby sed. 04, ombild. t. A-B C. I. Kolmodin 39, bolagets verkst. dir. Dansk v. konsul sed. 33. Stadsfullm. 13-38, led. av bered-n :utsk. samt ordf. i drätselkamm. 26- 38, kyrkofullm. sed. 33, ordf. i styr. f. riksbankens avd :kont., köpm :gillet o. Gotl. :Sångarförb., led. av styr. f. lärl:- o. yrkessk., DBV Sparb., Angf. A-B Gotl., Gotl. Järnv. A-B m. m. Hoibby: kvartettsånig. RNO, RVO, RDDO, Sv. sångarförb. GM, Försäkr. A-B Hansas GM.
translated: Kolmodin, Carl Israel, Vice Consul, merchant, Visby, b. June 21, 1876, in Roma, Gotland, son of Johan K. and Rosalie Höggren. Married in 1907 to Elva Forsberg. Children: Carl-Olof, b. 1908, Bo, b. 1910, Ingrid, b. 1912. Own company in Visby since 1904, transformed into A-B C. I. Kolmodin in 1939, Director of the company. Danish Vice Consul since 1933. City council member from 1913 to 1938, member of various committees and Chairman of the Finance Committee from 1926 to 1938, church council member since 1933, Chairman of the Board of the branch of the Swedish National Bank, Merchants' Guild, and Gotland Singers' Association, member of the Board of Apprentice and Vocational Schools, DBV Savings Bank, Angf. A-B Gotland, Gotland Railway Company, and more. Hobby: quartet singing. Order of the North Star (RNO), Order of Vasa (RVO), Order of Dannebrog (RDDO), Swedish Singers' Association Grand Master (Sv. sångarförb. GM), Insurance Company Hansa's Grand Master (Försäkr. A-B Hansas GM).
